Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.

Netting_Transaction_Data.description: Submit for Approval is a boolean flag indicating if the transaction is to be submitted or saved in draft mode. If this flag is set, the transaction will be submitted, otherwise the transaction is saved in draft.

CompanyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CompanyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CompanyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Netting_Transaction_Data.description: This is the company that tranasction is for. This is the reference id value of the company.

CurrencyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CurrencyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CurrencyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Netting_Transaction_Data.description: This is the reference id of currency of the transaction  If no currency is specified, Workday will first look to see if the payer/payee has a preferred currency and if not, currency will be populated with the company base currency.  If the company base currency is not allowed currency for payer/payee then transaction will not be able to be submitted for approval.

Netting_RuleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Netting_RuleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Netting_RuleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Netting_Transaction_Data.description: Reference an existing Netting Rule for the Netting Transaction.
Format is  MM/DD/YYYY.If this is left blank, Workday will populate transaction date with the current date.
Supplier Invoice Document Date on or after Date
Supplier Invoice Document Date on or before Date
Customer Invoice Document Date on or after Date
Customer Invoice Document Date on or before Date

Financials_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Filename of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Encoding of the Attachment.
Boolean attribute identifying whether the Attachment is compressed.

validation.validation: If a file name is specified for a Financial Attachment, File Content and Content Type are required.

Supplier_Invoice_For_Netting_Data.description: Reference to an existing Supplier Invoice.

validation.validation: Remove invoices that are already part of a settlement run or netting transaction that is in draft or in progress.
Remove the invoices with a currency that is different to the currency on the netting transaction.
Do not include invoices which are direct intercompany
Remove invoices or invoice adjustments that are on hold status.
Remove invoices that include 1099-MISC suppliers or change the netting rule to exclude the 1099-MISC supplier.
validation.description: Remove invoices that include 1099-MISC suppliers or change the netting rule to exclude the 1099-MISC supplier.

validation.validation: Remove the invoices from contract workers.

validation.validation: Remove the invoices from the inactive supplier.

validation.validation: Remove the invoices that are in match exception.

validation.validation: The invoices must be approved and not fully paid.

Supplier_Invoice_For_Netting_Data.description: Amount to net for the referenced invoice document.

validation.validation:
Enter an amount to net greater than zero on these transactions:
* positive customer invoice adjustments
* positive customer invoices
* positive supplier invoice adjustments
* positive supplier invoices
validation.description:
Enter an amount to net greater than zero on these transactions:
* positive customer invoice adjustments
* positive customer invoices
* positive supplier invoice adjustments
* positive supplier invoices

validation.validation: Enter an amount to net not equal to zero.
validation.description: Enter an amount to net not equal to zero.

validation.validation: Enter a negative amount to net for a negative supplier invoice.
validation.description: Enter a negative amount to net for a negative supplier invoice.

validation.validation: Enter a negative amount to net for negative supplier invoice adjustments.
validation.description: Enter a negative amount to net for negative supplier invoice adjustments.

validation.validation:
Enter an amount to net that is greater than or equal to the amount due on these negative documents:
* Supplier invoice 
* Supplier invoice adjustment
* Customer invoice 
* Customer invoice adjustment
validation.description:
Enter an amount to net that is greater than or equal to the amount due on these negative documents:
* Supplier invoice 
* Supplier invoice adjustment
* Customer invoice 
* Customer invoice adjustment

validation.validation: Enter an amount to net that is equal to or less than the amount due on the invoice.
validation.description: Enter an amount to net that is equal to or less than the amount due on the invoice.

Supplier_Invoice_For_Netting_Data.description: Amount netted for the Referenced Supplier Invoice Document.  Read Only.

Netting_Transaction_Data.description: Supplier Invoice for Netting Data.  A Netting Transaction should have at least one Supplier Invoice for Netting.

validation.validation: Supplier Invoice References and Supplier Invoice Adjustment Reference must be unique.  Cannot use the same Supplier Invoice Reference or Supplier Invoice Adjustment Reference more than once.
One or more of your supplier invoice or invoice adjustments is invalid for the netting transaction.
Remove the supplier invoices that aren't part of the netting rule set up for the Company.

Remove the supplier invoices that have an invoice date which doesn't match the criteria in the # of Days Invoices are Open Before Netting field. You can also change the field set up in the Invoice Eligibility Rule.
Enter a Total Amount to Net that is greater than zero on both the supplier invoice document and customer invoice document.
Add supplier invoice adjustments to the invoice eligibility rule on the Netting Rule or remove the supplier invoice adjustments to submit this transaction.
Submit supplier invoices with dates on or before the transaction date.
Remove the supplier invoices that aren't part of the netting rule set up for the Supplier.
Remove the invoices with an inactive Remit-To Connection.

validation.validation: Remove invoices or invoice adjustments that are on hold status.

Remove the invoices with a currency that is different to the currency on the netting transaction.
Do not include invoices which are direct intercompany
Remove the invoices with withholding tax payment realization tax code.

Customer_Invoice_for_Netting_Data.description: Amount netted for the Referenced Customer Invoice Document.  Read Only

Netting_Transaction_Data.description: Customer Invoice for Netting Data.  A Netting Transaction should have at least one Customer Invoice for Netting.

validation.validation: Customer Invoice References and Customer Invoice Adjustment Reference must be unique.  Cannot use the same Customer Invoice Reference or Customer Invoice Adjustment Reference more than once.
One or more of your customer invoice or invoice adjustments is invalid for the netting transaction.
Remove the customer invoices that aren't part of the netting rule set up for the company.
Submit customer invoices with dates on or before the transaction date.
Remove the customer invoices that aren't part of the netting rule set up for the Customer.
Add the Customer Invoice Types to the invoice eligibility rule on the Netting Rule or remove the invalid Customer Invoice Types to submit this transaction.
Enter a Total Amount to Net that is greater than zero on both the supplier invoice document and customer invoice document.
Add customer invoice adjustments to the invoice eligibility rule on the Netting Rule or remove the customer invoice adjustments to submit this transaction.

Remove the customer invoices that have an invoice date which doesn't match the criteria in the # of Days Invoices are Open Before Netting field. You can also change the field set up in the Invoice Eligibility Rule.
Submit a Netting Rule set up for the Company.
